A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I really wanted to see Luke Skywalker return as a Jedi Master and eventually restoring Coruscant back to its former glory with the Jedi Council.

Unfortunately\, SPOILER\, they killed him off "to make room for the new characters". I read this reason in an article interview with "Rian Johnson". Very disappointing. He said something about feeling dread that it would make sense to kill him off in this "chapter". Well\, it doesn't make sense to me.

I am extremely disappointed.

Oh\, and I also don't understand why we have to forget the old? Why do this? Is it because that Johnson writer may be a control freak and wants to impose his ideals on the audience? Does he want full freedom on just walking all over the "franchise"?
